title: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic high fantasy trilogy written by English philologist and University of Oxford professor J.R.R. Tolkien. The story began as a sequel to Tolkien's 1937 fantasy novel The Hobbit, but eventually developed into a much larger work. Written in stages between 1937 and 1949, with much of it being written during World War II, it was originally published in three volumes in 1954 and 1955. It has since been reprinted numerous times and translated into at least 38 languages, becoming one of the best-selling novels ever written.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series and Rowling's debut novel, it follows the adventures of a young wizard, Harry Potter, and his friends Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley, all of whom are students at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel that tells the story of Scout Finch, a young girl living in the American South during the Great Depression. Scout's father, Atticus Finch, is a lawyer who defends a black man falsely accused of rape.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that tells the story of Elizabeth Bennet, a young woman who must decide whether or not to marry a wealthy suitor, Mr. Darcy.
A dystopian novel that tells the story of Winston Smith, a man who lives in a totalitarian society where the government controls every aspect of people's lives.

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel set in the summer of 1922 about the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his passion for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

title: Brave New World
description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of a technologically advanced and highly controlled society.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel narrated by a teenage boy who is disenchanted with the world and struggling to find his place in it.

title: Moby Dick
description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge, centered around Captain Ahab's quest to kill the monstrous white whale Moby Dick.

title: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, who is persuaded to accompany a group of dwarves to reclaim their homeland from a dragon.

title: The Shining
description: A horror novel that follows the story of a family that becomes the winter caretakers of an isolated hotel, where supernatural forces lead to terrifying events.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A gothic novel that tells the story of a man who remains youthful and handsome while a portrait of him ages and reflects his inner ugliness.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
description: A historical novel set during the French Revolution, depicting the plight of the French peasantry.

title: The Road
description: A post-apocalyptic novel that follows a father and son's journey through a devastated landscape.

title: The Girl on the Train
description: A psychological thriller that weaves a gripping story of love, obsession, and deception.

title: Animal Farm
description: A novella that uses a group of farm animals who rebel against their human farmer as an allegory of the events leading up to the Russian Revolution of 1917 and the early years of the Soviet Union.

title: The Silmarillion
description: A collection of mythopoeic works that tells the story of the creation and early history of the world of Middle-earth, the setting of many of Tolkien's works.

title: The Casual Vacancy
description: A novel for adults that explores the lives of the residents of a small English town after the death of a parish councilor.

title: Go Set a Watchman
description: A novel set in the mid-1950s, providing a sequel to Lee's famous novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird', portraying the later lives of the characters from the original work.

title: Emma
description: A novel that follows the story of Emma Woodhouse, a young woman who is determined to be a matchmaker and meddle in the romantic affairs of others.

title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
description: A dystopian novel that explores a totalitarian society where critical thought is suppressed under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother.

title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
description: A fantasy novel that continues the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he and a group of dwarves seek to reclaim their homeland from the fearsome dragon Smaug.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
description: The third novel in the Harry Potter series, following the adventures of Harry, Hermione, and Ron as they uncover the mystery of Sirius Black.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird: Collector's Edition
description: A collector's edition of the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel that delves into themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

title: Pride and Prejudice and Zombies
description: A parody novel that combines the classic Jane Austen story with elements of zombie fiction, adding an undead twist to the beloved tale.
